notes: DellaVigna, Enikolopov, Mironova, Petrova, and Zhuravskaya (2014) 'Cross-Border Media and Nationalism: Evidence from Serbian Radio in Croatia'. IV design using signal strength (s1) as instrument for radio availability (radio1). Cross-sectional municipality-level analysis. Main outcome is Nazi_share (vote share for nationalist HSP party). Weighted by population (people_listed). Data included as .dta file.

design_audit.notes: Cross-sectional IV. Signal strength s1 instruments for binary radio availability radio1. Paper primarily reports OLS reduced-form results (radio1 on outcomes) and reduced-form signal strength results. Municipality-level, population-weighted, clustered at Opsina (municipality) level. Two control sets: controls_short (census/geographic) and controls_long (+ war/manual indicators).

claim_object.outcome_concept: Vote share for nationalist HSP party (Nazi_share)
claim_object.treatment_concept: Serbian radio availability in Croatian municipalities
claim_object.estimand_concept: Effect of Serbian radio exposure on nationalist voting, identified via geographic variation in signal strength
claim_object.target_population: Croatian municipalities within reception range of Serbian radio transmitters

baseline_specs.label: Table3-OLS-radio1-controls_long
baseline_specs.notes: OLS with long controls and region dummies (r1-r5), population weighted, clustered at municipality

baseline_specs.label: Table3-RF-s1-controls_long
baseline_specs.notes: Reduced-form: signal strength on Nazi_share with long controls

constraints.notes: Paper uses two main control sets: controls_short (11 vars: geographic + census) and controls_long (21 vars: + war, monuments, street names, brewery, bliz). Region dummies (r1-r5) always included. Linked adjustment because the same controls appear in both first stage and reduced form.

canonical.notes: Clustered at municipality (Opsina2) level as in all paper specifications.

variants.notes: Conley spatial HAC SE (paper mentions spatial correlation concern in appendix).

budgets.notes: Moderate-to-large budget. Control pool is substantial (21 variables in long set). Paper itself runs extensive robustness (Tables 3-8).

sampling.notes: Controls organized into blocks: geographic (log_distance_full, bliz), census (logpop, male_share, z2, z3, z6, Croats, higher_educ, ec_active, disable_share2), manual/war (war, mon, name_of_the_streets_c, name_of_the_streets_i, pivo_S), region (r1-r5, always included). Stratified sampling across blocks.

diagnostics_plan.notes: First-stage F-statistic for signal strength predicting radio availability.
AET balance test (Table 2 Panel B) checking that instrument is not associated with outcome through controls.

design_audit.notes: Same IV structure as G1 but for graffiti outcome (probit/dprobit model in paper).

claim_object.treatment_concept: Serbian radio availability in Croatian municipalities
claim_object.estimand_concept: Effect of Serbian radio exposure on ethnic tensions (graffiti as proxy)
claim_object.target_population: Croatian municipalities within reception range of Serbian radio transmitters

baseline_specs.label: Table5-dprobit-radio1-controls_long
baseline_specs.notes: Paper uses dprobit for binary outcome. For specification search, can use LPM or logit/probit marginal effects.
